CIRCULAR  NO.   9    /  2002 
 
 
Sub : -  PRE-FLIGHT ANTI-SABOTAGE CHECKS 
 
It has been brought to the notice of this Bureau that two airline style 
passenger flotation devices (life vests) were found in a location reportedly used 
by al-Queda. The flotation devices were new and complete with CO2 cartridges. 
 
2. 
However, according to information it is not clear as to how, when and why 
the flotation devices were acquired. But it is pertinent to mention that al-Queda 
could be using flotation devices to conceal improvised explosive devices (IEDs). 
 
3. 
It is also learnt that in December 1994, Ramzi Yousef detonated a bomb 
on Philippines Airlines flight 434. it is also believed that the bomb may have been 
in or next to the life vest pouch under the seat. 
 
4. 
The above information may be shared on need-to-know basis. 
 
5. 
In view of the above information, Air Operators operating to and from India 
must ensure to take all precautionary measures to preclude possibility of any 
lapse at the time of pre-flight anti-sabotage checks. 
 
 
(R. K. Singh) 
Addl Commissioner of  Security (CA) 
 
 
NO.CAS-6(3)2001-DIV-1 Date   : 04.03.2002
